page.title: 07The Ecology of Heybridge
page.content:
The flora
A single visit to the{canal} resulted in these sightings:-
Flowers : lilies, water marigolds, cow parsley, greater spearwort, hyacinth, flowering currant, tufted vetch, common vetch, horseshoe vetch, common clover, horseshoe clover, birdsfoot, bullrushes, reedrushes and rannoch rushes.
Trees : silver birch, hawthorn, horse chestnut, sweet chestnut, plane, elderberry, sycamore and many willows.
Heybridge Wood is not next to the{ {canal}but has been denoted a "special landscape area". It is a managed wood of mainly pine trees which are harvested for industrial purposes.
